intro: Ononis juncea, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
